verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, my rock, who trains my hands for battle and my fingers for combat.

verses.kjv: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.
verses.ct: He is my loving God and my fortress, my stronghold and my rescuer, my shield and the one I take refuge in, who brings nations under my authority.

verses.kjv: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!
verses.ct: LORD, what are human beings that you would pay attention to them? What are mortals that you would even think about them?

verses.kjv: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.
verses.ct: People are like a breath of air; their days are like a passing shadow.

verses.kjv: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
verses.ct: Part your heavens, LORD, and come down; touch the mountains so they pour out smoke.

verses.kjv: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.
verses.ct: Hurl your lightning and scatter your enemies; shoot your arrows and throw them into chaos.

verses.kjv: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;
verses.ct: Reach down from heaven; rescue me and pull me out of these overwhelming floods, out of the grip of these foreigners

verses.kjv: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
verses.ct: whose mouths speak nothing but lies and whose right hands are raised in false oaths.

verses.kjv: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.
verses.ct: God, I will sing a new song to you; on a 10-stringed harp I will make music to you.

verses.kjv: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.
verses.ct: He is the one who grants victory to kings, who saves his servant David from the deadly sword.

verses.kjv: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
verses.ct: Rescue me and save me from the grip of these foreigners, whose mouths speak nothing but lies and whose right hands are raised in false oaths.

verses.kjv: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:
verses.ct: Then our sons in their youth will be like well-nurtured plants, and our daughters will be like pillars carved to adorn a palace.

verses.kjv: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:
verses.ct: Then our storehouses will be full, overflowing with every kind of provision, and our flocks will multiply by thousands and tens of thousands in our fields.

verses.kjv: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.
verses.ct: Then our cattle will be loaded with produce, with no breach in the walls, no exile, and no cries of distress in our streets.

verses.kjv: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.
verses.ct: How fortunate are the people who have all of this! How fortunate are the people whose God is the LORD.
